channel.title: CVE Feed for publify_core -- publify_core
channel.description: The latest CVEs for publify_core -- publify_core

item.title: CVE-2021-25975|2024-08-03T20:19:19.334Z -- publify_core -- publify_core
item.description: In publify, versions v8.0 to v9.2.4 are vulnerable to stored XSS as a result of an unrestricted file upload. This issue allows a user with “publisher” role to inject malicious JavaScript via the uploaded html file.

item.title: CVE-2021-25973|2024-08-03T20:19:19.019Z -- publify_core -- publify_core
item.description: In Publify, 9.0.0.pre1 to 9.2.4 are vulnerable to Improper Access Control. “guest” role users can self-register even when the admin does not allow. This happens due to front-end restriction only.

item.title: CVE-2021-25974|2024-08-03T20:19:19.446Z -- publify_core -- publify_core
item.description: In Publify, versions v8.0 to v9.2.4 are vulnerable to stored XSS. A user with a “publisher” role is able to inject and execute arbitrary JavaScript code while creating a page/article.
